results.description: The person who is primarily responsible for the data themselves. Often the PI of the project that generated the data. This role will be able to create a request and edit their created or assigned requests.
The DAAC staff member who guides the Request through Earthdata Pub workflows and iterates with the PoC on questions. This role will be able to add and edit requests.

The DAAC staff member who coordinates all DAAC Requests. Coordinators assign a Request to Managers. There may be multiple DAAC Data Coordinators per DAAC. Some DAACs may choose to combine the Coordinator and Manager roles by assigning staff to both.
A DAAC or ESDIS staff member who is interested in monitoring progress in Earthdata Pub but does not need edit or write permission. This can be a DAAC Manager or similar.
An Earthdata Pub admin can see and edit most aspects of Earthdata Pub.
